intro: Choretrum glomeratum var. glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered choretrum, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
